page.title: 09Farming - A turkey Farm
page.content: An unusual and specialised activity is the production of turkey eggs for hatching .The farm receives a flock of{5000 white hen turkey's}every six months.They are housed in large,open wooden sheds where they are fed and watered automatically.The stag turkeys are kept in a small pen and{the hen {are fertilised by artificial {insemination.}When the flocks are changed,the hen turkey's will be slaughtered for meat.The eggs are sent for incubation to provide young turkey's for the largest turkey processing company in the world.There are few problems with disease thanks to preventive drugs.Four employers work continually in the turkey units,and all living in the locality of Morningthorpe.
